title: AI Enablement Specialist (Training & Ops)
summary: Transforms how internal teams work by selecting tools, designing training programs, and driving safe AI adoption across the organization.
whyFutureReady: Companies are buying AI tools but employees don't know how to use them effectively.
Requires high empathy, teaching ability, and translation between tech and business.
Focuses on human behavior change and workflow redesign, which AI cannot automate.

items: Develop and deliver workshops on prompting, tool usage, and safe AI practices.
Create engaging learning materials (videos, guides, cheat sheets) for non-technical staff.
Run 'office hours' or clinics to help teams solve specific problems with AI.
Evaluate new AI tools for business utility and security compliance.
Manage licenses and access controls for enterprise AI platforms.
Monitor usage metrics to identify teams that need more support.
Identify and champion internal 'power users' to scale adoption.
Gather feedback on tool friction and advocate for improvements.
Communicate policies on ethics and data privacy in plain language.

proofProjects.title: Department Playbook
whatYouBuild: A customized guide for a specific team (e.g., HR, Sales) on how to use AI for their daily tasks
List of pre-tested prompts and approved workflows

proofProjects.title: Tool Evaluation Matrix
whatYouBuild: A rubric for scoring potential AI tools based on cost, security, ease of use, and integration
Comparison of 3 leading tools for a specific use case (e.g., meeting notes)

starterPlan30Days: Audit current AI usage: Survey 10 colleagues to find out what tools they use and where they struggle.
Master one enterprise tool: Become the go-to expert on your company's main AI platform.
Host a lunch-and-learn: Teach one simple workflow (e.g., summarizing meetings) to a small group.
Create a 'Quick Start' one-pager: A simple PDF guide for new hires on safe AI usage.
